DOC.brief_summary: To test the association between anti-Chlamydia serum titers and anti-Mycoplasma antibodies with Acute Coronary Syndromes.
DOC.brief_title: Chlamydia and Mycoplasma in Coronary Artery Disease
DOC.detailed_description: One hundred and twenty-six patients were divided into 4 groups: Acute Coronary Syndrome with ST-elevation, Non-ST-elevation, stable coronary artery disease, and individuals without coronary disease. Anti-Chlamydia and anti-Mycoplasma IgG antibodies were measured at baseline and after 6 months.
DOC.criteria: Age >18 yrs Males and females Agreed to sign the informed consent Refusal to sign the informed consent Followup not possible For the "acute" groups, time between the pain beginning and randomization >24 hours Active infections Use of antimicrobial agents within the last 30 days Endstage diseases with life expectancy <6 months
